nodes.bodyText: done
Can this be null here?
Yes, because the markdown documentation can be available without deprecated parameter documentation.
But does exitDeprecatedParametersDocumentation() get invoked then?
It does not get invoked when the deprecated params doc is not available. So null check is removed
What about the return type?
Here the purpose of validating params is to check the status of deprecation of each parameter. The return type is not checked here because we don't want to check the deprecation for the return type.
Got is, so if I have a function that returns Foo and Foo is deprecated I'll get a warning when returning a value, but not for the return type in the function signature?

IMO, logging a warning for returns T1 will be useful.
WDYT? Looping in @hasithaa too.
Logging a warning for return type is more useful for API developers.
Fix it here 7dfcccc
Do we need to maintain this text? Can't we just maintain isCorrectDeprecationLine?
Done
Shall we use a plain old foreach instead?
Done
Why do we need this change?
The reason to assign fields into a list of BLangSimpleVariable is that in the method validateDeprecatedParameter we need parameter as BLangSimpleVariable instead of SimpleVariableNode.
We may have to deprecate this instead.
This was added recently and it had only one usage. I think it is better to delete it.
Can't we just return here if documentation.deprecatedParametersDocumentation != null? Will remove the nesting and the initialization to empty map at L565.
When the markdown doc is available and deprecation doc is not available(an error scenario), we need to pass this map to compare with actual params. See L573
It is not mentioned in the spec. That why we choose one way to document the deprecation in parameters

For function parameters yeah, because we don't have any other way to document them.
For object fields, we have a straightforward way to do this, and we'll probably not support documenting fields at type level anyway in a future release (since they can now be documented at field level.). WDYT?
Looping in @hasithaa, @pubudu91 too.
Yeah, the only reason we needed a new way for params is because documentation is not allowed on params.
Fixed
Don't we allow deprecated on record fields?
Nope, this is what spec says.
If this method is called, text.equals("# # Deprecated parameters") always evaluates to true right? I think we have to just have a method setCorrectDeprecationLine
Accordingly we may not need to pass the description at https://github.com/ballerina-platform/ballerina-lang/pull/22287/files#diff-87627a1d9b0a3201b74c0067bc4bdcbbR3410
Done

This still wouldn't detect scenarios like the following right?
# Docs for `i`
# 
# # Deprecated parameters
# + i - deprecated i
int i = 1;
We need to check all places where documentation is allowed.
Shall we work on a separate PR to fix this?
@KavinduZoysa can you push the change for this too?
This change is done

There is a validation below to check if the deprecation annotation is available right? And the annotation specifies on what kind of constructs it can be used.
So, IMO we don't need this check. Since it'll fail below anyway.

Yes, that validation is there and it says invalid documentation: ''Deprecated'' documentation is only allowed on constructs annotated as ''@deprecated''
# This is a test service
#
# # Deprecated parameters
# + x - deprecated x
# # Deprecated
service s on new Listener() {

} 

But in this example, without the above validation, it says invalid documentation: ''Deprecated'' documentation is only allowed on constructs annotated as ''@deprecated'', with the above validation it says ''Deprecated'' documentation is not allowed here.

The issue IMO is that we have two point to validate.
We are trying to do manually part of the validation that is based on the annotation.

Why are we passing false for isDeprecationAnnotationAvailable and isExpected?
A resource is a function (resource function) so the annotation is allowed.
for resource, deprecation is not supported.
It is still working. Yes, I misunderstood. That validation is not needed.
Can't we use the deprecationDocumentation variable?
Done
@KavinduZoysa we can remove this right?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1236,5 +1236,11 @@ error.invalid.deprecation.documentation=\
 error.deprecation.documentation.should.available=\
   constructs annotated as ''@deprecated'' must have ''Deprecated'' documentation
 
+error.deprecated.parameters.documentation.not.allowed=\
+  ''Deprecated parameters'' documentation is not allowed here
+
+error.deprecation.documentation.not.allowed=\
